qas.question: Was there more than one racial class in the organized societies of the states of Myanmar?
During what age did the culture of Myanmar grow?

answers.text: This period is considered a golden age

qas.question: Who increased the spread of religious reforms in Myanmar?
Who is the monarch that has some of the most impressive built in their honor in the Myanmar

context: Like the Pagan Empire, Ava, Hanthawaddy and the Shan <a0_0>states were all multi-ethnic polities<a0_0/>. Despite the wars, cultural synchronisation continued. <a1_0>This period is considered a golden age<a1_0/> for Burmese culture. Burmese literature "grew more confident, popular, and stylistically diverse", and the second generation of Burmese law codes as well as the earliest pan-Burma chronicles emerged. <a2_0>Hanthawaddy monarchs<a2_0/> introduced religious reforms that later spread to the rest of the country. Many splendid temples of <a3_0>Mrauk U<a3_0/> were built during this period.
